p: We used the maximum value of the significant wave height ( H s) during each month of the 15-year time series as a measure of wave disturbance. H s represents the mean of the largest one-third of the waves recorded during a 30-min sampling period and the maximum H s has been shown to be significantly correlated with the amount of kelp biomass loss 18 39 40. H s data for the period 2001–2015 were obtained from the Coastal Data Information Program's nowcast wave-propagation model for locations nearest to each of the nine kelp forest sites 40. The model provides hourly estimates of H s along a 10 m isobath at an 800 m longshore resolution. Longer term records of H s (1980–2015) used to compare the wave climate during our study with that during the severe El Niños of the later 20th century were obtained from the Wave Information Studies hindcast model nearest the location of the Harvest platform buoy (Station 46218) located offshore in the Santa Barbara Channel (34.454 N 120.782 W). The Harvest buoy provided additional H s data from 2012–2015.
